This initiative bridges the gap between technology and purpose. By enabling a group of volunteers (app analysts, developers, and product owners) to build tailored ServiceNow apps for nonprofits, we empower them with automation, visibility, and efficiency.

  1. Old-age homes can better manage residents, volunteers, and donations.

  2. Food banks can track distribution and supply needs in real time.

  3. Nonprofits can centralize data, automate reporting, and focus more on service, not spreadsheets.
    The measurable impact: improved service delivery, higher volunteer engagement, and sustainable tech adoption for good.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many nonprofit organizations — especially small ones like old-age homes, shelters, and community aid centers — struggle with limited technical resources. They often rely on outdated tools, spreadsheets, or manual processes that slow down operations and reduce their ability to serve people effectively.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. A dedicated volunteer tech group forms cross-functional teams (App Analyst, Developer, Product Owner) to design, build, and deploy ServiceNow-powered apps customized for nonprofit needs.
    The platform will leverage:

  1. App Engine Studio for rapid low-code development

  2. Flow Designer for automations

  3. Knowledge Management for internal team training

  4. Service Portal or Employee Center for an intuitive interface
    After launch, the volunteers train nonprofit staff to manage and scale the solution independently, ensuring long-term sustainability.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Yes — the project would require ServiceNow App Engine access and sandbox instances for development. Integration with common nonprofit tools (Google Sheets, Excel, or donation tracking systems) may be needed.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Ensuring consistent volunteer participation and scheduling across teams

  2. Data security and access control for sensitive beneficiary or donor information

  3. Simplifying complex workflows so they’re easily maintainable by non-technical users

  4. Ongoing support and documentation after deployment
